title: The Widow's Bread
description: Bring bread from the diaconia to Maria of Chalcedon and her children

objectives.description: Speak with Deacon Stephanos at the diaconia near the forum
Find Maria of Chalcedon in the eastern quarter
Return to Chrysostom and tell him about Maria

journal.start: The Archbishop caught me stealing but didn't turn me in. Instead, he asked me to bring bread to a widow named Maria in the eastern quarter. He says there's food for me too if I do this.
journal.diaconia: I spoke with Deacon Stephanos at the diaconia. He gave me bread for Maria and food for myself. He said the Church sees those who serve.
journal.maria: I found Maria and her children. They hadn't eaten in days. When her son saw the bread, he cried. I've never felt anything like that before.
journal.complete: I told Chrysostom about Maria. He said I became 'the hands of Christ.' I don't know what that means, but... something has changed.

failConditions.journal: I stole the bread meant for the widow. The old patterns are hard to break.

outcome.journal: I shared my own portion with the children. I'm still hungry, but it felt right.

thematicNotes.orthodoxTeaching: This quest embodies Matthew 25:35 ('I was hungry and you gave me food'). The player experiences being Christ's handsâ€”the Orthodox understanding that we participate in Christ's work through service to others.
chrysostomQuotes: If you cannot find Christ in the beggar at the church door, you will not find Him in the chalice.
The gold bit is not the only way to give alms; there are many means of almsgiving.
This is the rule of most perfect Christianity: that we should be concerned for our neighbors as much as for ourselves.
